definition: surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: Call it my weakness. Call it kindness, " one brigadier told The Guardian.
sentences.chinese: 那是我的弱點，我的善良，”一個准將告訴《衛報》。

sentences.english: Several writers for the Guardian have made what I believe is an unjustifiable leap.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，衛報的幾位撰稿人來了個離譜的大躍進。

sentences.english: The Guardian I note did not favour me with an obituary.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到，《衛報》毫不眷顧於我，連個訃告都不登。

sentences.english: Burnham told the Guardian he is hopeful that mother and daughter will soon be reunited.
sentences.chinese: 伯納姆告訴衛報記者，他希望母女二人能夠儘快團聚。

sentences.english: The Guardian tells the grim tale.
sentences.chinese: 衛報杜撰了這個悲慘的故事。

sentences.english: The Guardian thinks ministers have "caved in.
sentences.chinese: 衛報認爲大臣們已經“接受”了。

sentences.english: The Guardian report could not be independently verified.
sentences.chinese: 衛報的報道未能得到單方面確證。

sentences.english: New evidence reported by the Guardian has reignited the debate.
sentences.chinese: 衛報報道的新證據又激起了爭論。

sentences.english: "It would have been quite an expensive lemur, " he told the Guardian at the time.
sentences.chinese: “它將是十分昂貴的狐猴”，那時他告訴衛報說。

sentences.english: The Manchester Guardian first appeared 190 years ago today.
sentences.chinese: 曼徹斯特衛報創辦於190年前的今天。

sentences.english: They refused to comment when contacted by the Guardian.
sentences.chinese: 當《衛報》記者聯絡他們時，他們拒絕發表評論。

sentences.english: The Guardian is also developing its own paid-for app.
sentences.chinese: 《衛報》也正在開發自己的付費應用程序。

sentences.english: Dreadnought, " Tench wrote in the Guardian newspaper."
sentences.chinese: 坦奇在發表在《衛報》上的文章中說。

sentences.english: The Guardian provides a complete list of snakes in the study.
sentences.chinese: 《衛報》刊有該次研究的所有蛇類的完整清單。

sentences.english: "It was thoroughly colourless stuff, " the Guardian reported at the time.
sentences.chinese: “暗淡無光，”那是當時衛報的標題。

sentences.english: "He was a natural leader, " she told the Guardian.
sentences.chinese: “他是個天生的領導者，”她對《衛報》記者說。

definition: South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)

pinyin: Ying1 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1

definition: The Sun (the name of various newspapers, notably in the UK and in Hong Kong)
variant of 弗吉尼亞州|弗吉尼亚州/Virginia, US state

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Jing1 ji4 Lun4 tan2
